concept.title: Appliance administration
concept.shortdesc: System administrators can administer the appliance by using the , or by using the command line. You can configure network interfaces, DNS addresses, and search domains. You can configure the server locale, server timezone, date, and time. You can configure the appliance name. You can shut down or restart the appliance. You can start and stop the server, and you can set the level of messages that are displayed in the system logs. You can also configure appliance users to administer by using the , or the command line.
